body: Thanks for fixing this. Let me please follow up with a (probably) related issue: I used to send an HTML5 Notification from the preload script of a `BrowserWindow`. This works fine in version 2.0.5, but no more in 3.0.0-beta.3 with a `ReferenceError: Notification is not defined`.
@jakobvogel Better to create a new ticket for that and reference this.

issue.title: Notification (+115 more) APIs aren't defined synchronously in preload scripts

labels.name: bug/regression :leftwards_arrow_with_hook:
labels.description: A new version of Electron broke something

labels.name: status/confirmed
labels.description: A maintainer reproduced the bug or agreed with the feature

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
* Electron Version: 3.0.0-beta.3
* Operating System (Platform and Version): macOS 10.13.6
* Last known working Electron version: 2.0.5

**Expected Behavior**
While launching the app, a notification should be triggered via the preload script of the `BrowserWindow`.

**Actual behavior**
An error is reported on the console: `ReferenceError: Notification is not defined`

**To Reproduce**
```sh
$ git clone https://github.com/jakobvogel/electron-quick-start -b preload-notifications-3beta
$ npm install
$ npm start || electron .
```

**Screenshots**
_Working (2.0.5)_
![screen shot 2018-07-24 at 15 02 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36069303/43140449-4e8ee5a6-8f54-11e8-98ac-23ed5fd30def.png)

_Not Working (3.0.0-beta.3)_
![screen shot 2018-07-24 at 15 00 56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/36069303/43140839-d541a8ae-8f54-11e8-8616-ada163de44e6.png)

**Additional Information**
General HTML5 Notification support was already discussed in #13620 and fixed.
